document.docAuthor: An, Jiandong, Huang, Jiaxing, Shao, Youquan, Zhang, Shiwen, Wang, Biao, Liu, Xinyu, Wu, Jie & Williams, Paul H.
document.masterDocTitle: The bumblebees of North China (Apidae, Bombus Latreille)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The bumblebees of North China (Apidae, Bombus Latreille)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Bombus pyrrhosoma
Dalla Torre, 1896
: 544
, unjustified emendation.

Bombus rufus
Friese, 1905
: 511
(not of
Villers, 1789
: 328
=
B. pascuorum (Scopoli))
.
Pyrobombus (Lapidariobombus) wutaishanensis
Tkalců, 1968
: 39
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution in North China .
Widely distributed within the zone between the Neimenggu, the Qinghai- Tibetan plateau, and the Qinling mountains. Abundant at low to medium elevations of the Yanshan mountains in Beijing and Heibai, at medium elevations of the Bashang plateau between northern Hebei and southern Neimenggu, at medium elevations of the Taihangshan mountains in Shanxi, at mediuma elevations of the Liupanshan mountains in southern Ningxia, at mediuma elevations of the loess plateau in eastern Gansu and western Shaanxi, at mediuma elevations of the west Qinling mountains in Gansu, and at medium to high elevations of the east Qinghai-Tibetan plateau meadows in Gansu. Common at medium elevations of the Helanshan mountains in northern Ningxia, at medium elevations of the Huanggangliang forest park of the southernmost of the Great Khingan mountains in Neimenggu, at medium elevations of the Lvliangshan mountains in western Shanxi, and at medium elevations of the Qinling mountains in Shaanxi. Rare at medium to high elevations of the northwest Qilianshan mountains in Gansu, and at the medium elevations of the edge of the Mu Us semi-desert in northern Shaanxi and northern Ningixa. 325 localities (
Fig. 146
) between 159–4011 m (IAB).

Similar species in North China
. This species is often similar in its white-banded colour pattern to
B. validus
(see the key;
Figs 137
, 147 ).

Distribution in China .
Beijing, Tianjin , Hebei, Shanxi, Neimenggu, Liaoning, Henan, Hubei, Chongqing, Sichuan, Shaanxi, Gansu, Qinghai, Ningxia (IAB).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 146–147. 146. Map showing the distributions of
B. pyrosoma
in North China with record in black spots, the province boundaries in dark grey, and all sites with records of all bumblebee species in light grey. 147.
Bombus ( Melanobombus ) pyrosoma
worker visiting
Vicia unijuga
( Fabaceae ) in Beijing.
